title: The best breakfast in Tacoma
text: This place never fails to impress with substantial, high quality meals. Whether it is huge fluffy blueberry pancakes , perfectly cooked thick bacon, or eggs Benedict, breakfast is always memorable.

title: Looking for seafood??
text: With one day only in beautiful Siesta Key, we wanted dinner to be straight forward seafood. With lots of choices we settled on grilled file fish and a dish of scallops and shrimp. Both were absolute winners. Had to try the clam chowder and found it the best ever.

title: Amazingly small, amazingly delicious
text: Five tables, a fire oven, and a carefully chosen menu. Pizza that is unique and excellent. A family run enterprise that is a must if you come to Lyme Regis. Reservations required.

title: An exquisite garden
text: An ever changing palette of color and beauty as one walks the many paths in the garden. The views of the valley below and the grandeur of the giant trees add to the serenity. Adding the tea offered in the cafe makes Kiftsgate a perfect place in an afternoon.

title: A wonderful Sunday Roast
text: This is an ancient pub/ Inn serving delicious meals and local ales. The staff is attentive and friendly. It is in a central location and has the feel of a classic upmarket pub. There is a priest hole in the floor dating from the 1530s . It is a pleasure to dine there.

title: The best breakfast
text: Choices for everyone that are done with care and quality. The winter berry smoothie is amazing. The porridge is creamy and topped with beautiful berries and brown sugar. Staff is attentive and knowledgeable. Portions are large.

title: A bit of a disappointment
text: Had reservations for dinner . It was to be the highlight of our Broadway stay but felt dinner was not up to our expectations. Ordered the scallops and pork belly dinner. It came with two small scallops and literally a brushstroke of the butternut squash. The pork was rather plain tho tender and the pork skin crisps were so hard I thought I might break a tooth. Our wine was good and our server friendly. Will be changing our restaurant choice next time.

title: A classic English pub
text: This beautiful pub and inn offers a brilliant location, helpful and friendly staff, (talking about you Stewart!) and delicious pub food. Plus live music several times per week. The rooms are furnished with antiques and , tho simple, offer a true English pub experience. Owner Andrew gave us a “tour” of the furnishings in our room which made us appreciate it even more.

title: Creative menu with spectacular view
text: This is the spot for a special dinner while watching the famous sunset of Santorini. The menu is varied and exhibits a creative spirit in the use of traditional ingredients. The watermelon with grilled haloumi is a showstopper. Staff was knowledgeable and so personable.

title: Good family location
text: This is a beautifully designed resort with a great pool, very good restaurant, and knowledgeable, helpful staff. It is clear that all who work here really care about providing the best service. It is not in the area of the steep villages known on Santorini so there is no spectacular view and it is a drive to all tourist areas. But it is a welcome and quiet place to come back to after a busy day.

title: Great family hotel
text: This small resort is run by a gracious and well informed family who are helpful and welcoming. The suites are spotless and complete in amenities. There is a pool and cafe with a small but delicious menu. Breakfast is included. The beach and several more cafes are located just a short walk away.

title: Perfect location
text: This lovely small hotel is located on a quiet promenade only one short block from the cafes and shops leading up to the Acropolis. The staff, particularly John, is very helpful and welcoming. Breakfast is located in a gracious parlor room and has food for every taste. The rooms remind one of the homes of yesteryear yet are complete.

title: Amazing experience
text: The Acropolis is 1000 ft above sea level and quite a climb in the heat. But, oh, so worth it. We were approached by a private guide while standing in the very long ticket line and we decided to go with the guide. It was the best decision of the day. So much information and no more line.

title: Fun and delicious
text: This is the place to take friends or family for delicious and unique ice cream. The staff are friendly and make it a fun visit as ice cream shops should be. The LB crack ice cream is my favorite tho we will be back to try many more.

title: Very local, very good
text: We had seen on Facebook that this cafe was named one of the top ten small restaurants in Washington so we decided to stop. Well worth the distance. It was filled with local people who have long known of this special place. Service is friendly and helpful and even the chef came out to check on us. Hamburgers are a specialty and are memorable in appearance and taste. We will put this cafe on our “to do” list when we pass through Quincy.

title: We’ll be back!
text: Varied and unique offerings on the lunch menu at this small and friendly winery/restaurant. The chef came to our table to give suggestions and explain offerings. There were four of us and each of us felt we had chosen the best dish. The lemon creme brûlée for dessert was a perfect ending to a delicious dining experience.

title: Best BLT in the area!
text: Our favorite stop on any given Friday to order the generous BLT sandwich and a cup of the delicious clam chowder. Always consistently good as are the other menu items. The hamburger is outstanding.

title: Our choice always for Mexican food
text: Lots of selection plus a lunch choice of reasonably priced smaller plates. The grilled chicken salad is fresh and delicious, and my husband loved the chimichanga. Service is friendly and welcoming.

title: Delicious local flavor
text: An upbeat, colorful little spot with many local choices. The best macaroni salad I have tasted here in the islands. Everything cooked fresh when ordered. Worth a trip to Waimanalo.

title: Hawaiian Sunset tour
text: A scenic and informative tour by DeeJay of the areas to the east of Honolulu. He gave great tips regarding photos with our IPhones and showed us how to use the light and scenery to make our own creations. Followed with a great lunch at Ono Steak and Shrimp Shack in Waimanalo. Great tour for everyone.

title: An iconic Hawaiian evening
text: A bustling, noisy restaurant, bar, and outside deck overlooking the beach and ocean. Great at sunset with live music and good food. Menu is varied and reasonable. Friendly staff .

title: A remarkable addition to Steilacoom
text: A small unique restaurant offering a truly memorable experience in dining. Features local and seasonal fare so the menu varies. There were four of us, all ordering different dishes and each one of us felt we had the best.

title: A welcome surprise
text: It had been five years since we visited Waikiki and we were concerned about the renovation of the International Market Place. Would Waikiki lose an iconic and historic market to high end generic shops? It is a relief to find a well done and respectful area with the giant banyan tree at its heart.

title: Small hotel in a great location
text: With friendly , knowledgeable staff and a central location this is a good choice for Waikiki. Rooms are newly renovated, WiFi is free. There is a pool, a bar, a coffee shop, and a good Italian restaurant on site. Two blocks or less to the beach.

title: Always a favorite
text: Every visit to Waikiki includes a visit to Rum fire. Especially at sunset when the lights start to twinkle on and Diamond Head turns pink. Food is casual, drinks are done well, and the view is first rate.

title: A little shopping center with everything
text: An open , pleasant shopping area that serves almost every need from a gas station to post office to grocery to lovely boutique. Galleries, a real book shop, a high end salon, the best Japanese restaurant, even a movie complex make up some of the offerings.

title: Great sunset, not so great entrees
text: A good stop for drinks and appetizers, especially at happy hour and sunset. Lunch entrees disappointing, lackluster. Staff at times attentive and at other times hurried and sloppy.

title: Love this place!
text: Right on the beautiful A Bay beach in Waikaloa. Perfect to wander over to the restaurant while spending the day lolling on the sandy beach. Good menu, a wee bit pricey and sometimes staff is too busy but still our favorite spot along the coast.

title: A beautiful retreat
text: A Hawaiian retreat for everyone. Located in a garden and forest setting that feels a million miles away from the cares and stress of city life. Beautiful, spacious rooms with large and gracious common areas. Gardens of exotic flowers. And service accompanied with smiles and sincerity.

title: Dinner par excellent
text: Every aspect of dinner was exceptional from the service to every course we chose. Wine was crisp and chilled, dinner was served immediately from the chef. It was indeed a highlight of our stay in Hawaii.

title: An unexpectedly delightful evening
text: We wandered into Jars Meze not realizing it would be one of the best meals we would experience in Bath. The service from each of the family members was caring, knowledgable, and the food was amazing. We had the lamb shank and not only was it ample, it was tender and well seasoned. The Greek wine was excellent, a good choice with the meat. The dessert was over the top delicious. We will certainly visit again.

title: Welcoming rest after a day of walking
text: A beautiful stop right on the trail of the Cotswold Way. Host Lucy is delightful and the accomodation is modern and unique. Even has laundry facilities and a kitchen. Lucy will provide a delicious dinner if ordered in advance. The shepherd's hut is a great memory.

title: Beautiful townhouse in perfect location
text: This is a wonderful location for a trip to sightsee in Bath. The rooms are gracious and beautifully decorated. The hosts are welcoming and able to provide knowledgable information about the city and its restaurants. The breakfast offered is a true fine dining experience and host Peter makes each guest feel at ease.

title: Relaxing and informative ocean cruise
text: The staff, boat, and weather all came together to make the trip so pleasant. The whales were abit shy and that was disappointing. But they are wild and we take our chances to see them. Denver, the naturalist, was so knowledgeable and approachable. And Jon, the captain, always had a ready smile.

title: A casual, friendly sunset cruise along the beautiful Kona coast.
text: The three hours flew by as we smoothly cruised along the coast, listening to the history of the area and enjoying the live music. The staff was so efficient and intent on making sure every guest was comfortable. The buffet was well done and bountiful.

title: Efficient, clean, and welcoming
text: We stayed here eight weeks while on a job location. The staff was very friendly and ready to help. It is well maintained, has a clean and equipted gym, a snack room, a small business office, and free parking. The place is by a busy highway but noise was not an issue. It is easy to find off of a major interstate and many restaurants are within walking distance.

title: An adventure in Korean bbq
text: This is a Korean buffet/bbq that is fully loaded with all sorts of meats and condiments. Staff is very helpful with newcomers to the cuisine

title: What a grand salad bar!
text: Many choices of main entre and salad bar is amazing. Place is well staffed, very clean. Most seating is booths.

title: A day to remember
text: Frederic had planned the day to include out of the way villages, scenery, and historical places on the backroads as he transported us from the coast up to the town of VaisonLa Romaine. He knows the best and unusual spots for sampling unique French foods and wines. When we arrived at our destination we felt we had also made a good friend along the way.

title: A must see
text: An essential stop in Avignon. The self tour was sufficient tho take the time to explore nooks and crannies.
